message.content:
Since $\lceil x\rceil = \lfloor x\rfloor$, we can let $k = \lceil x\rceil = \lfloor x\rfloor$.  Then
\[k + k + x = 4.8,\]so $2k + x = 4.8$.  Since $k = \lceil x\rceil \le x < \lceil x\rceil + 1 = k + 1 = \lfloor x\rfloor + 1 \le x + 1$, $2k + 2 \le 2x + 1 < 2k + 3$.  Then $4.8 < 2x + 1 < 6.8$, so $1.8 < 2x < 5.8$.

Dividing by 2, we get $0.9 < x < 2.9$.  Since $2k + x = 4.8$, $2k = 4.8 - x$, so $9.6 - 2x = 4.8 - x$.  Simplifying, we get $x = 4.8 - 9.6 = \boxed{-4.8}$.
